rev.comment: Revert advertising to revision 101247042 dated 2007-01-17 02:59:27 by Accurizer using [[:en:Wikipedia:Tools/Navigation_popups|popups]]
/* Second-generation Commercial MMORPGs */ put back in an important concept - UO2's only worth mentioning as it shows EA's belief that market was saturated
/* Economics of MMORPGs */ typo and grammar correction
Modified caption text to remove POV opinions about system reqs / graphic realism
rv change - discuss on talk page if you don't like WoW image, but this was requested as part of the Article Improvement feedback
Moving Ultima screenshot back to the top of the article; it was a much better representation of a massively multiplayer game than "two gnomes flying on eagles".
Put in an EverQuest 2 instead of the world of warcraft one to balance out the page (Previously it had no EverQuest 2 pictures and 2 World of Warcraft ones.
sticking back in the unsourced, but completely necessary, reason to mention Second Life
Reverting edit, if you think you know something bigger than WoW then please edit the article and provide a source
Tweaked section on Ragnarok, added a source from CNET
Removed unsourced opinion about explaining why Second Life is mentioned here
Found a secondary source for the assertion that Phantasy Star Online was the first console MMORPG
Tweaked section title, removed opinionated comments that will never be sourced
Reorganized slightly to reflect the move to a commercial Internet (games were already "world wide")
Tweaked the MUD caption, I'm quite sure it isn't the oldest multiuser game, but is probably the oldest MP roleplaying game
/* MMORPGs in the new millennium */ few more changes
/* MMORPGs in the new millennium */ actually, I'm not sure on this... changing it back, put it in paragraph, added {fact}, other changes
/* MMORPGs in the new millennium */ FFXI wasn't the first, but first major MMO to allow console + PC together
/* The first gameworlds */ added a screenshot
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Transformers666|Transformers666]] ([[User talk:Transformers666|talk]]) to last version by Boneheadmx
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/66.184.129.145|66.184.129.145]] ([[User talk:66.184.129.145|talk]]) to last version by Tarinth
Updated screenshots: lead with WoW (largest commercial product), moved UO screenshot to appropriate section in History
Removing spambait, EQ and WoW don't exactly need to be listed as examples in this context
Slight reorganization, removed unsourced use of the term "MMGS"
Undo the search and replace of "massively" to "massive"
changed the number of subscribers from 7.5 to 8 million as recently stated by blizzard officials on "worldofwarcraft.com"
rv but add fact tag, need cite regarding "grey area" to support paragraph
/* Private servers */ Stealing code has nothing to do with reverse engineered servers
/* Private servers */ - nothing to do with copyright infringment
/* History */ The introductory paragraph doesn't need to repeat information; a summary would be okay, but what exists now is entirely insufficient.
[[WP:AWB/T|Typo fixing]], Typos fixed: occured → occurred, using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
Switching to 2-column reference list (we're getting a lot!)
Removing a citation that I am unable to confirm, and does not appear to be used in the article
/* Early commercial development <ref name="Online World Timeline">Koster, Raph (2002) "Online World Timeline," http://www.raphkoster.com/gaming/mudtimeline.shtml</ref> */
/* Early commercial development <ref name="Online World Timeline">Koster, Raph (2002) "Online World Timeline," http://www.raphkoster.com/gaming/mudtimeline.shtml</ref> */
Providing a secondary source regarding the original of the term MMORPG
/* MMORPGs in the new millennium */ cleanup
recent changes removed content and only added redundancy, so I reverted, and put in a common feature. few other minor changes.
/* Basic elements of MMORPG */ changed the heading to introduction
Easily surpassed by RuneScape and MapleStory.
re-writing first few sections to target non-computer gamer audiance
/* History */ removed ridiculous claim - MMOFRPG doesn't pass google test
/* Common features */ I love GW, but two good examples here is enough
seriously, it's "massively", not "massive". There's a wikiproject on it, and "massively" wins a googlefight.
Just because the authors don't like having it called an RPG doesn't mean it isn't one. Combat is NOT listed in the definition of RPG or MMORPG.
/* MMORPGs in the new millennium */ Moved the section on SecondLife to the MMOG article, as SecondLife is more accurately an MMOG/MMOSG rather than an RPG game.
changed "massively" to "massive" which is actually the corret spelling.
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/69.123.224.50|69.123.224.50]] to last version by Ehheh
/* Current trends in MMORPGs */ rewrote. tossed out an unsourced claim, and an odd source.
/* Current trends in MMORPGs */ removed repetition, and removed image (not yet tied to text)
/* Current trends in MMORPGs */ citing PCGamer
/* Modern MMORPGs */ adding a footer to 'Runescape'
/* Current trends in MMORPGs */ added some references (can be better but still relevant) and differentiated several game design trends
Fixing new sentence and marking it with {{fact}}
/* Current trends in MMORPGs */ poorly written sentance - rephrased and expanded
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/67.83.86.29|67.83.86.29]] ([[User talk:67.83.86.29|talk]]) to last version by Tarinth
/* MMORPGs in the new millennium */ finally added Second Life + co.

/* World-wide MMORPGs */ Extreme Opinion without Citation
/* Early commercial development <ref name="Online World Timeline">Koster, Raph (2002) "Online World Timeline," http://www.raphkoster.com/gaming/mudtimeline.shtml</ref> */

Removed Wiki article linksthat duplicate links already in the article, as well as a couple very borderline cases
